newsitem.title: UK: Blenheim says further approach made.
newsitem.headline: Blenheim says further approach made.

text.p: Blenheim Group Plc said in a statement it had received a further approach "at a level that the board has previously rejected."
It said the approach may or may not lead to an offer for the company and a further announcement would be made when appropriate.
The conference and exhibition organiser said it was responding to recent press speculation.

Shares in the company were up 45 pence at 412-1/2 pence by 1020 GMT following earlier rises after the Sunday Times newspaper reported that Reed Elsevier had held talks with Blenheim aimed at agreeing a takeover price.
Bid talks between Blenheim and an unknown company were terminated just three weeks ago. Reed Elsevier was rumoured then to be a predator.
Blenheim shares hit 470 pence at the height of the bid speculation at the beginning of June.
